verses.kjv: And Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants unto Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the room of his father: for Hiram was ever a lover of David.
verses.ct: King Hiram of Tyre sent his officials to Solomon when he learned that Solomon had been anointed as king to succeed his father, because Hiram had always been a close ally of David.

verses.kjv: And Solomon sent to Hiram, saying,
verses.ct: Solomon sent a message back to Hiram, saying,

verses.kjv: Thou knowest how that David my father could not build an house unto the name of the LORD his God for the wars which were about him on every side, until the LORD put them under the soles of his feet.
verses.ct: "You know that my father David was unable to build a temple for the name of the LORD his God because of the wars surrounding him on all sides, until the LORD gave him victory over all his enemies.

verses.kjv: But now the LORD my God hath given me rest on every side, so that there is neither adversary nor evil occurrent.
verses.ct: But now the LORD my God has given me peace on every side — there is no opponent and no threat of disaster.

verses.kjv: And, behold, I purpose to build an house unto the name of the LORD my God, as the LORD spake unto David my father, saying, Thy son, whom I will set upon thy throne in thy room, he shall build an house unto my name.
verses.ct: So I intend to build a temple for the name of the LORD my God, just as the LORD told my father David, 'Your son, whom I will place on your throne after you, will be the one to build a temple for my name.'

verses.kjv: Now therefore command thou that they hew me cedar trees out of Lebanon; and my servants shall be with thy servants: and unto thee will I give hire for thy servants according to all that thou shalt appoint: for thou knowest that there is not among us any that can skill to hew timber like unto the Sidonians.
verses.ct: So please order your workers to cut cedar logs from Lebanon for me. My workers will serve alongside yours, and I will pay your workers whatever wages you set. As you know, none of us have the skill in cutting timber that the Sidonians have."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Hiram heard the words of Solomon, that he rejoiced greatly, and said, Blessed be the LORD this day, which hath given unto David a wise son over this great people.
verses.ct: When Hiram received Solomon's message, he was overjoyed and said, "Praise the LORD today, who has given David a wise son to rule over this great nation."

verses.kjv: And Hiram sent to Solomon, saying, I have considered the things which thou sentest to me for: and I will do all thy desire concerning timber of cedar, and concerning timber of fir.
verses.ct: Hiram sent word to Solomon: "I've received your request, and I will supply everything you need — both cedar and cypress lumber.

verses.kjv: My servants shall bring them down from Lebanon unto the sea: and I will convey them by sea in floats unto the place that thou shalt appoint me, and will cause them to be discharged there, and thou shalt receive them: and thou shalt accomplish my desire, in giving food for my household.
verses.ct: My workers will transport the logs down from Lebanon to the coast. I'll have them formed into rafts and floated by sea to whatever location you specify, where they'll be unloaded for you to collect. In return, you will fulfill my request by providing food for my royal household."

verses.kjv: So Hiram gave Solomon cedar trees and fir trees according to all his desire.
verses.ct: So Hiram supplied Solomon with all the cedar and cypress timber he wanted.

verses.kjv: And Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand measures of wheat for food to his household, and twenty measures of pure oil: thus gave Solomon to Hiram year by year.
verses.ct: In exchange, Solomon gave Hiram 20,000 measures of wheat as food for his household, along with 20 measures of pure olive oil. Solomon provided this to Hiram every year.

verses.kjv: And the LORD gave Solomon wisdom, as he promised him: and there was peace between Hiram and Solomon; and they two made a league together.
verses.ct: The LORD gave Solomon wisdom, just as he had promised. There was peace between Hiram and Solomon, and the two of them entered into a formal treaty.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon raised a levy out of all Israel; and the levy was thirty thousand men.
verses.ct: King Solomon drafted forced laborers from all of Israel, totaling 30,000 men.

verses.kjv: And he sent them to Lebanon, ten thousand a month by courses: a month they were in Lebanon, and two months at home: and Adoniram was over the levy.
verses.ct: He sent them to Lebanon in rotating shifts of 10,000 per month — they would spend 1 month in Lebanon and then 2 months at home. Adoniram was in charge of the labor force.

verses.kjv: And Solomon had threescore and ten thousand that bare burdens, and fourscore thousand hewers in the mountains;
verses.ct: Solomon also had 70,000 laborers who carried loads and 80,000 stonecutters working in the hill country.

verses.kjv: Beside the chief of Solomon’s officers which were over the work, three thousand and three hundred, which ruled over the people that wrought in the work.
verses.ct: In addition, Solomon had 3,300 chief supervisors who directed the workers carrying out the project.

verses.kjv: And the king commanded, and they brought great stones, costly stones, and hewed stones, to lay the foundation of the house.
verses.ct: The king ordered them to quarry large, expensive stones and cut them precisely to lay the foundation of the temple.

verses.kjv: And Solomon’s builders and Hiram’s builders did hew them, and the stonesquarers: so they prepared timber and stones to build the house.
verses.ct: Solomon's craftsmen, Hiram's craftsmen, and the workers from Gebal shaped the stones and prepared both the timber and stone for building the temple.
